Description: A unique ID for each marketing campaign.
The promotional name of the campaign (e.g., "EQE Electric Launch").
The date the campaign began.
The date the campaign ended.
The digital channel used to run the campaign (e.g., 'Social Media').
The total budget for the campaign in EUR (€).
A unique ID for each specific car configuration.
The commercial name of the car model (e.g., "C-Class").
The body style or class of the vehicle (e.g., 'Sedan', 'SUV').
The type of powertrain (e.g., 'Electric', 'Petrol').
The year the model was released.
Manufacturer's Suggested Retail Price in EUR (€).
A unique ID for each user session (visit) on the website.
The date the session occurred.
The ID of the customer who visited the site.
The campaign that brought the user to the site. (not set) for non-campaign traffic.
Where the traffic came from (e.g., google, facebook).
The type of traffic (e.g., cpc for paid ads, organic for search).
The number of pages viewed during the session.
Indicates if the session was meaningful. 1 = Yes, 0 = No.
Indicates if the user booked a test drive. 1 = Yes, 0 = No.
A unique ID for each individual vehicle sale.
The date the sale was finalized.
The ID of the car that was sold.
The ID of the customer who made the purchase.
A unique identifier for the dealership.
The final transaction price in EUR (€).
The channel that generated the sales lead (e.g., 'Web-Campaign').
The campaign ID if the sale is directly attributable. (not set) for other sources.
